item.title: Nick add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Nick add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Nick add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Nick add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Nick add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Nick add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A day without sunshine is like, you know, night." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Nick add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I'm not afraid of death; I just don't want to be there when it happens." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Nick add a quote by William of Ockham
item.description: "Entia non sunt multiplicanda praeter necessitatem." -- William of Ockham

item.title: Nick add a quote by Vladimir Nobokov
item.description: "the evolution of sense, in a sense, is the evolution of non sense" -- Vladimir Nobokov

item.title: Nick add a quote by Martin Buber
item.description: "One cannot in the nature of things expect a little tree that has been turned into a club to put forth leaves." -- Martin Buber

item.title: Nick add a quote by Duke Ellington
item.description: "It doesn't mean a thing if you ain't got that swing" -- Duke Ellington

item.title: Nick add a quote by Blaise Pascal
item.description: "Il n'est pas certain que tout soit incertain. (Translation: It is not certain that everything is uncertain.)" -- Blaise Pascal

item.title: Nick add a quote by Dorothy Day
item.description: "I felt that the Church was the Church of the poor,... but at the same time, I felt that it did not set its face against a social order which made so much charity in the present sense of the word necessary. I felt that charity was a word to choke over. Who wanted charity? And it was not just human pride but a strong sense of man's dignity and worth, and what was due to him in justice, that made me resent, rather than feel pround of so mighty a sum total of Catholic institutions." -- Dorothy Day

item.title: Nick add a quote by John XXIII
item.description: "See everything, overlook a great deal, correct a little." -- John XXIII

item.title: Nick add a quote by dom camara
item.description: "when i fed the hungry they called me a saint. when i asked why they were hungry they called me a communist." -- dom camara

item.title: Nick add a quote by Archbishop Oscar Romero
item.description: " Beautiful is the moment in which we understand that we are no more than an instrument of God; we live only as long as God wants us to live; we can only do as much as God makes us able to do; we are only as intelligent as God would have us be. " -- Archbishop Oscar Romero

item.title: Nick add a quote by Henry J. Tillman
item.description: "If you're not part of the solution, you're part of the precipitate. " -- Henry J. Tillman

item.title: Nick add a quote by Philo
item.description: "Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a great battle." -- Philo

item.title: Nick add a quote by Pierre Teilhard De Chardin
item.description: "Someday, after mastering the winds, the waves, the tides and gravity, we shall harness for God the energies of love, and then, for a second time in the history of the world, man will have discovered fire." -- Pierre Teilhard De Chardin

item.title: Nick add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "In real life as in grand opera, arias only make hopeless situations worse." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Nick add a quote by Santa Teresa de Jesús
item.description: "If this is how you treat your friends, no wonder you have so many enemies." -- Santa Teresa de Jesús

item.title: Nick add a quote by Samuel Johnson
item.description: "It is better to suffer wrong than to do it, and happier to be sometimes cheated than not to trust." -- Samuel Johnson

item.title: Nick add a quote by Samuel Johnson
item.description: "Patriotism is the last refuge of a scoundrel." -- Samuel Johnson

item.title: Nick add a quote by Samuel Johnson
item.description: "Read over your compositions, and wherever you meet with a passage which you think is particularly fine, strike it out." -- Samuel Johnson

item.title: Nick add a quote by Plutarch
item.description: "The poor go to war, to fight and die for the delights, riches, and superfluities of others." -- Plutarch

item.title: Nick add a quote by Eddie Izzard
item.description: "They say that 'Guns don't kill people, people kill people.' Well I think the gun helps. If you just stood there and yelled BANG, I don't think you'd kill too many people." -- Eddie Izzard

item.title: Nick add a quote by Alfred Delp
item.description: "...we pretend to be grown up and responsible; we are so proud and self-assured--and look at the result. The world lies in bomb dust and ruins about us." -- Alfred Delp

item.title: Nick add a quote by Alfred Delp, S.J.
item.description: "It is undeniable that every human being is entitled to living space, daily bread, and the protection of the law as a common birthright; these are fundamentals and should not be handed out as an act of charity. " -- Alfred Delp, S.J.

item.title: Nick add a quote by Ariel Levy
item.description: "Sex is one of the most interesting things we as humans have to play with, and we've reduced it to polyester underpants and implants. We are selling ourselves unbelievably short." -- Ariel Levy

item.title: Nick add a quote by Cesar Chavez
item.description: "Non-violence is not inaction. It is not discussion. It is not for the timid or weak... Non-violence is hard work." -- Cesar Chavez
